Class Ball

java.lang.Object
  Ball

public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object

A physical ball object with a graphical representation. The ball itself determines how it moves in response to external forces acting on it. Movement is made by repeated calls to the move() method.

Version:
2 (04/11/2010) Based on a simple implementation of a Ball object written by Bruce Quig, Michael Kolling (mik) and David J. Barnes, for the book 'Objects First with Java - A practical Introduction Using BlueJ' (23-Jan-2002).
Author:
Robin Smith

          Constructor for BouncingBall object.

 void move(double delta_t)
          Erase this ball at its current position, then move it according to its new speed determined by the external forces acting on it in time interval delta_t.

Constructor Detail

Ball

public Ball(double xPos,
            double yPos,
            double xSpeed,
            double ySpeed,
            int ballDiameter,
            DoubleParameter gravity,
            DoubleParameter ballHyst,
            DoubleParameter airRes,
            DoubleParameter rollRes,
            Canvas canvas,
            int[] platformPos,
            BallSim sim)
Constructor for BouncingBall object.

Parameters:
xPos - initial horizontal position of the ball
yPos - initial vertical position of the ball
xSpeed - initial horizontal speed of the ball
ySpeed - initial vertical speed of the ball
ballDiameter - diameter of the ball
ballHyst - amount of ball hysteresis on bouncing
airRes - strength of air resistance
rollRes - strength of surface rolling friction
canvas - canvas to be drawn on
platformPos - array of platform heights as a function of x-position
dataAnalyser - DataAnalyser object to send data to

move

public void move(double delta_t)
Erase this ball at its current position, then move it according to its new speed determined by the external forces acting on it in time interval delta_t.
